intro: Psychotria potaroensis, commonly known as the Potaro psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with medicinal and ornamental value. The plant features small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
